intro: Geissomeria coccinea, commonly known as the scarlet globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows, hibiscus, and cotton. The plant is characterized by its bright red, globe-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Geissomeria coccinea thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
